data.title: Defence Minister Phumtham visits Ko Kut Operational Unit

data.title: Labour minister aims to present minimum wage proposal to Cabinet on Nov 12
data.description: Phiphat apologises for delay but assures govt will offer THB400 a day wage as New Year’s gift

data.title: Childhood development in Thailand, especially language skills, has worsened
data.description: Thailand's newborn population has continued to decline. In 1983, more than 1 million children were born annually, but by 2022, this number had dropped to 502,107, and it is expected to fall below 500,000 in the coming years.

data.title: Two Thai trade representatives appointed
data.description: The government has appointed Umesh Pandey and Werapong Prapha as Thai Trade Representatives.

data.title: Photo exhibit celebrates HM King’s 72nd birthday in three locations
data.description: Exhibition ‘Chalerm Phrakiat 72nd Birthday of King Maha Vajiralongkorn’ will run until December 31

data.title: Myanmar beauticians held for working illegally on Samui
data.description: Five Myanmar nationals were arrested on Koh Samui in Surat Thani province on Friday for working illegally as beauticians.

data.title: Iranian agents ‘plotted to kill Trump’
data.description: NEW YORK - US federal prosecutors said on Friday that Iranian plotters had discussed a plan to assassinate Donald Trump before he was elected as president this week.

data.title: Indonesian volcano erupts again
data.description: JAKARTA - Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki erupted at least three more times early on Saturday, spewing an ash column 9 kilometres high, as authorities planned to widen the restricted area on the Indonesian island of Flores.

data.title: British bikers nabbed for disturbance in Phuket
data.description: Nine British nationals riding around  Phuket  in the early hours have been apprehended for disturbing the public peace after police received numerous complaints from residents and tourists.

data.title: Pathum Thani official stabbed to death
data.description: A senior local administrator was found dead with multiple stab wounds to her neck at her house in Khlong Luang district of Pathum Thani on Friday night.

data.title: Can Brazil save the Amazon rainforest? Marina Silva is trying
data.description: WASHINGTON — When the United Nations (UN) climate conference COP29 kicks off Monday in Baku, Azerbaijan, attendees will be grappling with the re-election of former United States President Donald Trump. Countries will try to find a path forward that bypasses Trump, who is hostile to emissions-cutting policies and has vowed to pull the country back out of the Paris accord.

data.title: Cambodia talks to restart soon
data.description: Cambodia has been informed that negotiations on disputed maritime areas under the 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) will resume after a joint technical committee (JTC) is formed by the middle of this month, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra says.

data.title: Thai bodybuilders grab four gold on opening day of world championships
data.description: Kanticha Sichan the pick of the lot with two gold, as Kingdom amasses 11 medals in Maldives

data.title: National Health Security Office to investigate clinics that deny patient referrals
data.description: The National Health Security Office (NHSO) will probe clinics that fail to refer universal healthcare patients to hospitals, saying such conduct could result in legal action and punishment.

data.description: In recent years, Bangkok and other parts of Thailand have experienced an increase in Chinese business activity, including Chinese-owned dining, tourism and transportation investments.

data.title: Southeast Asia digital economy earns US$11 billion in 2024, e-commerce narrows losses
data.description: Southeast Asia’s digital economy made US$11 billion (S$14.5 billion) in profits in 2024, a blistering 2.5 times more compared with 2022.

data.title: Vietnamese PM proposes new Greater Mekong economic corridors for future
data.description: PM Pham Minh Chinh emphasised that as it evolves and develops, the Greater Mekong sub-region must continually innovate, keep pace with global trends and meet its demand for development.

data.title: US man charged with staging car crash shown in TikTok video
data.description: NEW YORK — A Brooklyn man who was shown in a popular TikTok dashcam video of a crash on a busy Queens highway was charged with insurance fraud, staging a motor vehicle accident, reckless endangerment and other crimes, prosecutors announced Friday.

data.title: More floods hit Mae Sai  as market bears brunt
data.description: CHIANG RAI: Locals of Mae Sai district have had to endure a fresh round of damage after more floods struck less than a month after recovering from rainy season inundation.

data.title: Amsterdam bans demos after ‘antisemitic’ attacks
data.description: AMSTERDAM - Amsterdam banned demonstrations for three days from Friday after overnight attacks on Israeli football supporters by what the mayor called “antisemitic hit-and-run squads”, and Israel said it would fly many fans home.
